summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 19, 2008, discussing the Jeff Epstein case. It includes internal DOJ/FBI coordination about a potential search warrant and a meeting with attorney Roy Black, as well as an unsolicited email from attorney Brad Edwards offering to share information and concerns about Epstein.

persons.context: Sent an unsolicited email to a prosecutor offering to meet and share information and concerns about Jeff Epstein, indicating he represents a client in the matter.

persons.name: Jason R. Richards
persons.context: Appears as a recipient in the email chain, involved in coordinating with prosecutors regarding the Epstein investigation and a search warrant.

persons.name: Jeff Epstein

events.title: Internal DOJ/FBI Coordination on Epstein
events.description: Email exchange among law enforcement discussing a call from defense attorney Roy Black, the need for a decision from the Deputy Attorney General's office by Friday, and plans to execute a search warrant.

events.title: Attorney Brad Edwards Reaches Out to Prosecutors
events.description: Attorney Brad Edwards sends an email to a prosecutor offering to meet and share information and concerns about Jeff Epstein, proposing dates in late July 2008.

keyFacts: Internal DOJ/FBI emails from June 19, 2008, show active coordination on the Epstein investigation, including discussion of a pending search warrant (SW).
The emails reference a need for a "green light" from Washington D.C. (the DAG's office) by that Friday, indicating high-level oversight of the case.
Defense attorney Roy Black is mentioned as having contacted the prosecutors, suggesting he was involved in Epstein's defense.
Attorney Brad Edwards, who would later represent many Epstein victims, proactively reached out to prosecutors in June 2008 offering to share information and concerns about Epstein.
